issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
The bridge device interface name must be same across all registered node controllers. We should update http://docs.hpcloud.com/eucalyptus/4.3.0/install-guide/rhel7_migration_scenarios.html section stating that, newly installed RHEL 7.2 node controllers must have configured with same bridge interface same as RHEL 6.7 node controller.

The above said statement must be updated in prerequisites section of "Live instance migration to RHEL 7" page.
{noformat}  
http://docs.hpcloud.com/eucalyptus/4.3.0/install-guide/rhel7_vm_migration_live.html#live_migration_rhel7
http://docs.hpcloud.com/eucalyptus/4.3.0/#install-guide/rhel7_migration_scenarios.html
{noformat}

Instance migration process has failed when source and destination node controllers have configured with different bridge interface names.

This was noticed when instance migration activity performed between two different node controllers running on different OS (One NC running on RHEL 6.7 and second NC running on RHEL 7.2).

 I guess, it is looking for same bridge interface on destination node controller when instance migration process gets started. It is essentially required, both source and destination node controllers to be on the same bridge interface for successful migration.

The following error messages were noticed on source node controller during instance migration activity.

{noformat}
2016-09-07 23:06:49 DEBUG 000002445 doMigrateInstances       | verifying 1 instance[s] for migration...
2016-09-07 23:06:49 DEBUG 000002445 doMigrateInstances       | verifying instance # 0...
2016-09-07 23:06:49 DEBUG 000002445 doMigrateInstances       | [i-58b26bfe] proposed migration action 'commit' (10.104.10.52 > 10.104.1.200) [creds=present]
2016-09-07 23:06:49 DEBUG 000002445 doMigrateInstances       | [i-58b26bfe] processing instance # 0 (10.104.10.52 > 10.104.1.200)
2016-09-07 23:06:49  INFO 000002445 doMigrateInstances       | [i-58b26bfe] migration source initiating 10.104.10.52 > 10.104.1.200 [creds=present] (1 of 1 active outgoing migrations)
2016-09-07 23:06:49 DEBUG 000028641 call_hooks               | executing '//etc/eucalyptus/nc-hooks/stop-delete.sh euca-nc-pre-hyp-check / /'
2016-09-07 23:06:49 DEBUG 000028641 migrating_thread         | [i-58b26bfe] connecting to remote hypervisor at 'qemu+tls://10.104.1.200/system'
2016-09-07 23:06:49  INFO 000028641 migrating_thread         | [i-58b26bfe] migrating instance
2016-09-07 23:06:49 ERROR 000028641 libvirt_err_handler      | libvirt: Cannot get interface MTU on 'br0': No such device (code=38)
2016-09-07 23:06:49 ERROR 000028641 migrating_thread         | [i-58b26bfe] cannot migrate instance, giving up and rolling back.
2016-09-07 23:06:49 DEBUG 000028641 migrating_thread         | 0 outgoing migrations still active
2016-09-07 23:06:49  INFO 000028641 migration_rollback       | [i-58b26bfe] starting migration rollback of instance on source 10.104.10.52
2016-09-07 23:06:49  INFO 000028641 migration_rollback       | [i-58b26bfe] migration source rolled back
{noformat}

Below find the two different bridge interface names configured on source and destination NC's

Source Node:

{noformat}
[root@odc-f-10 eucalyptus]# brctl show
bridge name bridge id       STP enabled interfaces
br0     8000.b8ac6f8e9c1f   no      em2
                            vn_i-1c41886f
                            vn_i-58b26bfe
[root@odc-f-10 eucalyptus]# 
{noformat}

Destination Node:

{noformat}
[root@odc-d-25 eucalyptus]# brctl show
bridge name bridge id       STP enabled interfaces
br1     8000.000000000000   no      
yes     8000.0026b9847dc2   no      em2
[root@odc-d-25 eucalyptus]# 
{noformat}
fields.summary: bridge device interface name must be the same across NCs

comments.body:
[~kshaik] are you saying that bridge device interface name must be same across all registered node controllers only in the case of LIVE migrations? (since you said to add it to the prerequisites in that topic: http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/#install-guide/rhel7_vm_migration_live.html)

Or is this applicable for ALL migrations from RHEL 6 to RHEL 7? If it's ALL, then perhaps the prereq should be mentioned on this topic instead: http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/#install-guide/rhel7_upgrade_euca_before_os.html

[~kmeredith], it is applicable for all migrations from RHEL 6 to RHEL 7.  It would be helpful for customers if you could add  a note to http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/#install-guide/configuring_bridge.html, stating make sure the bridge interface name must be same across all node controllers in a Eucalyptus cloud.

Instance migration was successful, when we configured node controller with  same bridge interface both on source and destination node controllers.

I think the issue is that _any_ live migration (not just during an upgrade, but afterwards in general use of 4.3) will fail if the bridge interface names of the source & destination NCs are different. 

[~kshaik] is this correct? Was this true in 4.2.2 and earlier as well?

So [~kmeredith] instead of "ifcfg-br0 or something similar" on that page, it should say to pick a name and stick with it for all NCs (both the file name "ifcfg-br0" and the "DEVICE=br0" in the file).
[~lincoln.thomas],  I did not test in 4.2.2 and earlier version. I will test it out in 4.2.2 and share my observations.

[~kmeredith],[~lincoln.thomas],  I have observed same results when I tested same scenario in 4.2.2.

Instance migration failed when source and destination node controllers have configured with different bridge interfaces.


Source Node Controller details as follows:

{noformat}
[root@odc-f-13 ~]# euca-version 
euca2ools 3.3.0-31-g2ab1bce (Yokohama)
eucalyptus 4.2.2
[root@odc-f-13 ~]# cat /etc/redhat-release 
CentOS release 6.7 (Final)
[root@odc-f-13 ~]# brctl show
bridge name	bridge id		STP enabled	interfaces
br0		8000.b8ac6f8d0739	no		em2
							vn_i-0c07b435
							vn_i-6b3be441
[root@odc-f-13 ~]# 
{noformat}

Destination Node Controller details as follows:
{noformat}
[root@odc-d-06-04 eucalyptus]# euca-version 
euca2ools 3.3.0 (Yokohama)
eucalyptus 4.2.2
[root@odc-d-06-04 eucalyptus]# brctl show
bridge name	bridge id		STP enabled	interfaces
br1		8000.e89a8fbdc109	no		em2
[root@odc-d-06-04 eucalyptus]# cat /etc/redhat-release 
CentOS release 6.7 (Final)
[root@odc-d-06-04 eucalyptus]#
{noformat}

Error message noticed on source node controller:

{noformat}
2016-09-19 23:35:50 DEBUG 000015061 doMigrateInstances       | verifying instance # 0...
2016-09-19 23:35:50 DEBUG 000015061 doMigrateInstances       | [i-6b3be441] proposed migration action 'commit' (10.104.10.55 > 10.104.1.213) [creds=present]
2016-09-19 23:35:50 DEBUG 000015061 doMigrateInstances       | [i-6b3be441] processing instance # 0 (10.104.10.55 > 10.104.1.213)
2016-09-19 23:35:50  INFO 000015061 doMigrateInstances       | [i-6b3be441] migration source initiating 10.104.10.55 > 10.104.1.213 [creds=present] (1 of 1 active outgoing migrations)
2016-09-19 23:35:50 DEBUG 000031218 migrating_thread         | [i-6b3be441] connecting to remote hypervisor at 'qemu+tls://10.104.1.213/system'
2016-09-19 23:35:50  INFO 000031218 migrating_thread         | [i-6b3be441] migrating instance
2016-09-19 23:35:50 ERROR 000031218 libvirt_err_handler      | libvirt: Cannot get interface MTU on 'br0': No such device (code=38)
2016-09-19 23:35:50 ERROR 000031218 migrating_thread         | [i-6b3be441] cannot migrate instance, giving up and rolling back.
2016-09-19 23:35:50 DEBUG 000031218 migrating_thread         | 0 outgoing migrations still active
2016-09-19 23:35:50  INFO 000031218 migration_rollback       | [i-6b3be441] starting migration rollback of instance on source 10.104.10.55
2016-09-19 23:35:50  INFO 000031218 migration_rollback       | [i-6b3be441] migration source rolled back
{noformat}

So, therefore, irrespective of OS version on node controller, bridge interface name must be same in all registered node controllers.

Added note which will appear in the NOON doc build - 
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/#install-guide/configuring_bridge.html
[~kshaik] please also let me know if you have any more feedback on this. Thanks for the help!
[~kmeredith], have you add same information in 4.3.0 upgrade page (Live migration ) ?.
No; I thought since this has always been the case, it should be only a clarification in the bridges section. [~kshaik] [~lincoln.thomas] let me know if it should be otherwise.

Added suggested content per [~lincoln.thomas]. Also corrected euserv commands while in this topic. 

Will appear in 6 PM doc build:
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/index.html#admin-guide/manage_nodes.html
Previous version of the page:
http://docs.hpcloud.com/eucalyptus/4.3.0/#admin-guide/manage_nodes.html
[~lincoln.thomas] OK to resolve? (see above comment for the last update)
